alert.note: Alert for North St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 4:27PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern St. Louis County through 500 PM CDT... At 427 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Cook, or 10 miles west of Lake Vermilion, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lake Vermilion around 430 PM CDT. Buyck around 440 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness Near Trout Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.
